intro: Diplacus thompsonii, commonly known as Thompson's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in capsule-like structures. Diplacus thompsonii is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
